review_title: Terrible management for a wonderful college
pros: Professors and students are quirky, kind-hearted, and passionate. I got to work with many professors through my position in admissions and they were all incredibly passionate educators. Students were equally interesting to get to know and work with. The college seems to be growing which is great, but
cons: God. Awful. Management. I can think of three members of the senior leadership team who create toxic work environments for their subsequent departments and employee turnover is very indicative of this. The president has GOT to clean house of these ineffective leaders. Communication is not clear, the direction of the college changes with the wind and mood of whoever is in charge at the moment, and professors are paid horribly.

review_title: Great co-workers, great students, poor management.
pros: Small, Caring Community.  Employees are incredibly dedicated to the mission of Brevard College, educating individuals of need.  Excellent place to live.
cons: Very stagnent, hierarchal, management. Input from staff is stonewalled with valueless red-tape at every turn. Employee burn-out is high, management takes advantage of minimum access to other jobs in the area. Minimal opportunity for professional development, poor cross-company communication, lots of scape-goating.
